PolicyName: SECURITY AND PRIVACY GROUPS AND ASSOCIATIONS
Control: Establish and institutionalize contact with selected groups and associations within the security and privacy communities:
a.To facilitate ongoing security and privacy education and training for organizational personnel;
b.To maintain currency with recommended security and privacy practices, techniques, and technologies;
c.To share current security and privacy information, including threats, vulnerabilities, and incidents.
Discussion: Ongoing contact with security and privacy groups and associations is important in an environment of rapidly changing technologies and threats. Groups and associations include a special interest groups, professional associations, forums, news groups, usersâ€™ groups, and peer groups of security and privacy professionals in similar organizations. Organizations select security and privacy groups and associations based on mission and business functions.
